words.definition: right or normal for a situation
words.example: It's appropriate to wear a suit when you go to the office.
Avoid the broken bottle on the floor.

words.definition: to act in a particular way
words.example: She always behaves well when her father is around.
A nice warm bath makes me feel so calm.
I was filled with concern after reading the newspaper.
The baby looked very content sitting on the floor.
I expect the bus to be here very soon.
We meet frequently, either at the beginning or ending of the week.
Smoking is a bad habit that can kill you.
My teacher instructs us in several subjects.
The men spoke about issues that were important to the people.
He spent all his money. There is none left.

words.definition: not becoming angry or upset easily
words.example: I had to be patient and wait until 5 o'clock to leave.
She has a positive future ahead of her after finishing college.

words.definition: to make someone suffer for breaking rules
words.example: To punish me, my teacher had me stand in the corner.

words.definition: to speak or act for a person or group
words.example: My lawyer will represent me in court.

words.definition: to move back and forth quickly
words.example: When people shake hands, it usually means they agree.

words.definition: to move quickly to more places
words.example: I like to spread butter on my toast.
My dog and I strolled through the park today.
There are only a few houses in my village.
